messages.title: Dear Resident
messages.content: I have lived in Benton for 30 years, my children went to school here and now my granddaughter goes to a local nursery. I love living here, doing my shopping locally and I'm totally committed to Benton and Forest Hall.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Refused permission for Persimmon’s development at the top of Station Rd. Wallends. Understands the importance of green space and dangers of increased traffic and development density.
Favors better use of brownfield sites. Emphasizes the need for affordable homes and better areas.

issues.environment: Draft Local Plan consultation. Separation of green spaces. Preservation for future generations.

housing.content: We do require housing, particularly affordable homes, but I believe we need better use of brownfield sites. I promise that I will do whatever I can to protect our greenfield areas.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have lived in Benton for 30 years, my children went to school here and now my granddaughter goes to a local nursery. I love living here, doing my shopping locally and I'm totally committed to Benton and Forest Hall.

politicalExperience.achievements: Involved in discussions with Punch Taverns to ensure Forest Hall Library remains open. Active in community pub discussions.

images.caption: Re-elect Janet Hunter & Mary Glindon as your Councillor and MP
